item.title: Obituary: Manmohan Singh, a gentleman politician - The Hindu
item.description:
Obituary: Manmohan Singh, a gentleman politician

Date: December 26, 2024 Source: The Hindu

Former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh, 92, passed away late on Thursday at the All India Institute of Medical Sciences. Dr. Singh retired as a member of the Rajya Sabha earlier this year, representing Rajasthan.

  • Dr. Singh was hailed as an “inspirational example” by Prime Minister Narendra Modi.
  • He is known for handling the Indo-U.S. nuclear deal and for supporting the Congress-led United Progressive Alliance.
  • Dr. Singh was instrumental in opening up India’s economy in 1991 as Finance Minister.
  • His tenure as Prime Minister saw shifts in India’s foreign policy towards the U.S.
  • Despite controversies including allegations of corruption, he received considerable admiration internationally.
“I honestly believe that history will be kinder to me than the contemporary media.” - Manmohan Singh

Dr. Singh’s legacy is one of significant contributions to India's economic reforms and foreign relations, leaving behind a profound impact on the country.

item.title: Former PM Manmohan Singh admitted to AIIMS Delhi, Priyanka Gandhi, JP Nadda reach hospital - The Times of India
item.description:
Former PM Manmohan Singh admitted to AIIMS Delhi, Priyanka Gandhi, JP Nadda reach hospital

Date: October 2023

Source: Times of India

Former Prime Minister Manmohan Singh has been admitted to AIIMS Delhi, prompting visits from notable leaders including Priyanka Gandhi and JP Nadda.

  • Manmohan Singh was hospitalized for medical evaluation.
  • Priyanka Gandhi and JP Nadda visited the hospital to check on Singh's condition.
  • The visit comes amidst concerns regarding Singh's health.
“We are all praying for his speedy recovery,” a spokesperson said.

Manmohan Singh's hospitalization has drawn public concern, highlighting the political and personal support from leaders across party lines.

item.title: Former PM Manmohan Singh Passes Away At 92 - Zee News
item.description:
Former PM Manmohan Singh Passes Away At 92

Date & Source: December 26, 2024, Zee News

Dr. Manmohan Singh, former Prime Minister of India, tragically passed away at the age of 92 after being admitted to AIIMS in Delhi. His death has been confirmed by the Delhi unit of the Congress party, which described it as an irreparable loss to Indian politics.

"The demise of renowned economist and former Prime Minister of the country, respected Manmohan Singh ji is an irreparable loss to Indian politics... Om Shanti." - Delhi Congress
  • Manmohan Singh's health deteriorated prior to his death.
  • The Congress party acknowledged his contributions to nation-building.
  • This is a developing story with more details expected to follow.

item.title: Former PM Manmohan Singh admitted to hospital, condition critical - The Hindu
item.description:
Former PM Manmohan Singh admitted to AIIMS hospital

Date: December 26, 2024 Source: PTI

Former Prime Minister Dr. Manmohan Singh, 92, has been admitted to the emergency department of All India Institute of Medical Sciences, Delhi, on Thursday (December 26, 2024).

  • He is currently in the emergency department of AIIMS.
  • The hospital has not yet released any details about his health status.
(More details awaited)

This admission raises concerns among supporters and the public regarding the health of the former leader.

item.title: Union Budget 2025: Modi govt mulls cutting income tax for individuals earning upto Rs 15 lakhs per annum - Deccan Herald
item.description:
Union Budget 2025: Modi govt mulls cutting income tax for individuals earning upto Rs 15 lakhs per annum

Published on: 26 December 2024, 15:20 IST

The Narendra Modi government is evaluating a proposal to reduce income tax for individuals earning up to Rs 15 lakhs per annum in the upcoming budget to alleviate the financial burden on the middle class amid a slowing economy.

  • The tax cut could potentially benefit many taxpayers, especially in urban areas with high living costs.
  • Indian taxpayers currently have the option between two tax systems: a legacy plan with exemptions and a newer, less complicated system introduced in 2020.
  • No definitive decision has been made on the size of the tax cuts; considerations will continue until the union budget announcement on February 1.
  • The reduction in taxes may encourage more people to choose the newer tax system.
  • The middle class is facing political pressure due to high taxes alongside slow wage growth and rising inflation.
“More money in the hands of the middle class might help rev up the economy, the world's fifth biggest.”

item.title: Current situation would not have arisen if Hindus had Kashi and Mathura, says VHP clearing the air on Mohan Bhagwat’s comments - The Hindu
item.description:
VHP Addresses Misinterpretation of Bhagwat's Comments on Temple-Mosque Disputes

Date & Source: December 26, 2024, The Hindu

The Vishva Hindu Parishad's (VHP) Milind Parande claims that the current temple-mosque disputes could have been avoided had Kashi and Mathura temples been handed over to the Hindu community. He emphasizes the need to understand RSS chief Mohan Bhagwat's comments in full context, especially given the historical demand for the temples since 1984.

  • The VHP argues that if the temples of Kashi and Mathura were under Hindu control, many disputes would not occur.
  • Parande asserts Bhagwat's comments were misinterpreted and need to be understood contextually.
  • Recent editorial controversies within RSS's own publications reflect differing views on temple-mosque disputes.
  • The ongoing discourse touches on the historical context of religious sites and the quest for civilizational justice.
“His statement must be looked at in full context and not in isolation.” - Milind Parande

The VHP's statements underscore the continuing complexity of religious disputes in India, highlighting the ongoing quest for recognition and justice within the broader socio-political landscape.

item.title: Cops Leaked Anna University Sexual Assault Victim's Identity, Alleges Tamil Nadu BJP - News18
item.description:
Tamil Nadu BJP Condemns Identity Leak of Anna University Sexual Assault Victim

Date: December 26, 2024

Source: News18

The Tamil Nadu BJP has accused the state's police of leaking the identity of a sexual assault victim connected to an incident at Anna University, where a 19-year-old student was attacked.

  • The incident took place on December 23, with the victim's details allegedly made public through the FIR.
  • BJP leader Annamalai has urged action against the officials responsible for this breach.
  • The accused is reportedly linked to DMK’s local leadership and has a history of similar crimes.
  • DMK leaders have denied the allegations, insisting the accused is not a primary member of their party.

“This heinous and imprudent act of the TN police is a blatant breach of the rights of the victim.” – Annamalai

The BJP is calling for urgent reform and accountability in handling sensitive cases involving victims of sexual assault.

item.title: Simran Singh, influencer and radio jockey from J&K, dies by suicide in Gurugram - The Times of India
item.description:
Simran Singh, Influencer and Radio Jockey from J&K, Dies by Suicide

Publication Date: October 1, 2023 | Source: Times of India

Simran Singh, a well-known influencer and radio jockey from Jammu and Kashmir, tragically passed away in Gurugram. Her untimely death has shocked her followers and the media.

  • Simran was a popular figure on social media, known for her engaging content.
  • Her family and friends have expressed their grief and disbelief at her passing.
  • The incident raises concerns about mental health awareness in the influencer community.
“She brought joy to many through her work. It’s heartbreaking to lose such a vibrant personality.”

The loss of Simran Singh has sparked a conversation about the importance of mental health and support systems for individuals in high-pressure professions like content creation and media.

item.title: 2024: When Supreme Court was busy fighting troubling remarks by HC judges - The Hindu
item.description:
2024: When Supreme Court was busy fighting troubling remarks by HC judges

Date: December 26, 2024

Source: The Hindu

The Supreme Court of India faced significant challenges in 2024 due to several controversial remarks made by High Court judges, leading to public outcry and judicial scrutiny.

  • The Supreme Court addressed a troubling trend of communal and sexist remarks from High Court judges.
  • Five-judge benches were established multiple times to manage the impact of these comments.
  • Justice Shekhar Kumar Yadav from the Allahabad High Court faces a pending motion for removal initiated by 55 Rajya Sabha MPs.
  • Justice Yadav's remarks about the Muslim community drew considerable backlash, emphasizing the divide in societal views.
  • In contrast, the Supreme Court responded differently to Justice V. Srishananda's remarks, highlighting a disparity in judicial handling.
  • Issues of political bias in the Calcutta High Court also prompted Supreme Court intervention, exemplifying ongoing tensions within the judiciary.
“The answer to sunlight is more sunlight. The answer is not to close our doors and shut out everything.” - Chief Justice D.Y. Chandrachud

The year marked a continual struggle for the judiciary to maintain integrity and public trust amid rising tensions and controversial statements.

item.title: Govt considers income tax relief for those earning up to Rs 15 lakhs: Report - The Times of India
item.description:
Govt considers income tax relief for those earning up to Rs 15 lakhs: Report

Date: Not specified Source: Not specified

The government is reportedly contemplating providing income tax relief for individuals earning up to Rs 15 lakhs.

  • The proposed relief aims to ease the financial burden on middle-income taxpayers.
  • Discussions are at an early stage, and further details are yet to be finalized.
  • Potential impact on government revenue and budgetary allocations will be assessed.
"This relief could significantly benefit millions of taxpayers across the nation."

This potential move by the government, if implemented, could provide much-needed financial support to a large segment of the population.

item.title: China approves world’s largest, $137-billion dam on the Brahmaputra close to the Indian border - The Hindu
item.description:
China Approves Construction of World's Largest Dam on the Brahmaputra River

Published on December 26, 2024 by The Hindu

China has approved the construction of the world’s largest dam, costing $137 billion, on the Brahmaputra River in Tibet, close to the Indian border, raising concerns among neighboring countries.

  • The dam is planned to be built at a gorge where the Brahmaputra makes a U-turn into India and then flows into Bangladesh.
  • It is part of China’s 14th Five-Year Plan and seeks to control water flow in the region, elevating fears of potential flooding during conflicts.
  • The dam will have the ability to generate over 300 billion kWh of electricity annually — enough for 300 million people.
  • The project poses significant engineering challenges due to its location along a tectonic plate boundary.
  • The Chinese government emphasizes the project’s role in environmental sustainability and national security, alongside providing significant economic benefits to the Tibet region.
“The lower reaches area features a vertical drop of 2,000 metres over a 50km distance, representing nearly 70 million kilowatts of resources that could be developed.” - Yan Zhiyong, Chairman of Power Construction Corporation of China

This dam not only focuses on hydropower but also aims to promote cooperation in South Asia and enhance energy resources.

item.title: 'Need to give chance to new power, leadership': Mallikarjun Kharge at CWC meet after assembly polls debac - The Times of India
item.description:
Need to give chance to new power, leadership: Mallikarjun Kharge at CWC meet after assembly polls debacle

Publication Date: Not Specified Source: Not Specified

During a recent Congress Working Committee (CWC) meeting, leader Mallikarjun Kharge emphasized the need for leadership change following the party's performance in the assembly polls. He called for a new approach to revitalize the party's image and outreach.

  • Kharge stresses new leadership is essential after recent electoral setbacks.
  • Focus on revitalizing the Congress party's approach to connect with voters.
  • Calls for introspection and strategic planning to regain lost ground.
“We must give a chance to new power and leadership to reinvigorate our party.”

This meeting marks a significant moment for the Congress party as it seeks to address its challenges and reshape its future direction.

item.title: Congress Working Committee meeting in Belagavi marking 100th anniversary of its Belgaum session that was presided over by Mahatma Gandhi - The Hindu
item.description:
Congress Working Committee Meeting in Belagavi

Published Date: December 26, 2024

Source: The Hindu

The Congress Working Committee met in Belagavi to commemorate the 100th anniversary of its session that Mahatma Gandhi presided over. Leaders emphasized the importance of fighting for Dr. B.R. Ambedkar's respect and criticized the government for undermining constitutional institutions.

  • Mallikarjun Kharge called for respect towards Dr. B.R. Ambedkar, criticizing remarks by Home Minister Amit Shah.
  • Sonia Gandhi highlighted the need to combat toxic environments that led to Gandhi's assassination.
  • Concern raised over decreasing faith in the electoral process due to government actions.
  • Emphasis on the Congress party's commitment to its ideological legacy and empowerment ahead of 2025.
  • Kharge stressed on the need for strategic direction and hard work for party rejuvenation.
“We will fight till the last breath for the ideology of Nehru-Gandhi and the respect of Babasaheb.” - Mallikarjun Kharge

In conclusion, the meeting reaffirmed the Congress party’s dedication to preserving Mahatma Gandhi’s legacy as a source of inspiration for future efforts.

item.title: Christmas takes ‘nightmarish’ turn as Bengaluru residents flock to malls: ‘Abandoned vehicles to walk for 3 kms’ | Today News - Mint
item.description:
Bengaluru's Christmas Chaos: Traffic Nightmares at Malls

Publication Date: December 2023

Source: Live Mint

Bengaluru witnessed a tumultuous start to the Christmas season as residents flocked to malls, resulting in significant traffic chaos. Many had to abandon their vehicles and walk several kilometres to reach their destinations.

  • Traffic congestion at major malls, especially Mall of Asia, leading to complaints from commuters.
  • Social media users labeled the situation a “traffic nightmare” with long walks to malls.
  • Criticism of inadequate parking facilities and the mall's location on airport road.
  • The city faced similar issues last Christmas, with mall management previously facing action due to congestion.
  • Heavy footfall reported in various popular areas ahead of New Year celebrations.
“People had to leave their vehicles and walk 3 km to reach Mall of Asia. Yesterday was a traffic nightmare for commuters,” wrote one user.

The situation underscores the need for better traffic management and infrastructure planning as Bengaluru gears up for holiday festivities.

item.title: Anna University rape issue: BJP’s Annamalai says he won’t wear footwear until DMK govt is ousted - The Times of India
item.description:
Anna University rape issue: BJP’s Annamalai says he won’t wear footwear until DMK govt is ousted

Publication Date: October 2023 | Source: Times of India

In a bold statement, BJP leader Annamalai has pledged not to wear footwear until the ruling DMK government is removed, citing the ongoing issues related to the Anna University rape case. His act of protest underscores the political tensions surrounding the incident.

  • Annamalai's protest highlights political dissatisfaction with the DMK government.
  • The phrase 'won’t wear footwear' symbolizes the urgency and importance he places on the matter.
  • The case has sparked widespread outrage and demands for accountability from the authorities.
“I will not wear shoes until there is justice for the victims,” Annamalai stated during his press conference.

This protest by Annamalai is indicative of the growing unrest among political factions in Tamil Nadu regarding safety and justice for women.

item.title: Budget 2025: Govt may cut income tax rates to lift consumption, say report - Business Standard
item.description:
Budget 2025: India Considers Income Tax Cuts to Boost Consumption

Publication Date: January 2025  Source: Reuters

India is looking into potential income tax reductions for individuals earning up to Rs 15 lakh to support the middle class and stimulate consumption amid economic challenges.

  • The proposal aims to aid millions of taxpayers, particularly in urban areas facing high living costs.
  • Taxpayers have the option to choose between two tax systems: one allowing exemptions and the other with lower rates but no major exemptions.
  • A final decision on the cuts will be made closer to the budget announcement on February 1.
"More money in the hands of the middle class might help rev up the economy."

While the government grapples with high inflation and political pressure regarding tax rates, the proposed cuts aim to alleviate the financial burdens faced by many.

item.title: India considers cutting personal income tax to lift consumption, sources say - Reuters India
item.description: No summary available for this article. Click the link to read more.
